message: It is important to utilize tools, like Tweetdeck, Hootsuite, Seesmic, and others to maximize posting and attention awareness. What other tools for posting and attention do you use?
You gotta use Crowdbooster! Helps you get more out of your time. Schedule your tweets to go out only at the best time. Email me ricky[at]crowdbooster(dot)com for invites =) w00t CONVORE
http://48ers.com is a decent search that includes FB.

@rickyyean I seem to recall putting in for an invite when it first was announced. I just checked and apparently missed the invite in my inbox! I am leery of significant automation, but will certainly give it a look.
Been using Crowdbooster its pretty awesome, would be good if it also integrated other social platforms though.
@rickyyean I see by your email, you are part of the team...we should talk. ;) *free ideas await
@mm4rley I can say after running social media reports from something like 22 different reporting sites yesterday that Crowdbooster does give some pretty unique reports. (for a free tool)
@kevinmullett awesome. Glad you found it!!! Let me know how I can help.
@kevinmullett awesome! yes, let's chat. I'll follow / DM you on Twitter, could you follow back?
What other posting, engagement, alert, or attention tools do you use? Anyone using Topsy.com, Backtype.com, or Postrank.com for monitoring mentions?
@kevinmullett @mm4rley we have even better reports rolling out some time this week, be on the look out!
@scottyholm Hi Scotty, I'll DM you an invite. Could you follow me back?

@rickyyean I checked. I already follow you on Twitter.
And how do all these goodies relate to work?  Is there a comparison site like 'consumer reports?
I will take a look - and report back!  Thx!
@dmathis1 oneforty.com reviews most of these different tools

@dmathis1 these tools can relate to business or personal social media account development. For businesses specifically, the higher ups want to see an efficient use of time and reports on if efforts are worth continuing.

I havent  tried the reporting feature yet, I work for a agency and manage multiple campaigns so think kind of reporting will be very useful. How quick is the turn around for the reports, can I generate these myself ?
I use CoTweet almost exclusively for Facebook and Twitter management. Still looking around for reporting tools
@tamara CoTweet is great! would love to help you with your reporting needs. Feel free to shoot me an email david at crowdbooster.com
@mm4rley Hey, we're still rolling it out to users - feel free to shoot me an email david at crowdbooster.com
TweetDeck is great tool and now with ifttt is easy to get new about your profiles, for example into your email box
Another one that I've heard great things about is Shoutlet http://www.shoutlet.com/
/msg @rickyyean hi! (Wonder if that works?)
My favorite: http://timely.is
@Thomasknoll hey!
@kevinmullet i'm interested in an invite as well..i'm sending you an email now...thanks!
Anyone try socialflow yet? any good?
@Thomasknoll that worked!
@rickyyean it "worked" but I was trying to do a priv
I think multi-platform or multiple accounts software like pidgin  will be very useful for companies in Indonesia.

I use pidgin. This software is great for combining various chat services, facebook, twitter. This software is very light, especially good for computers that have a lower specification. I noticed that many companies in Indonesia that use social media as a means of customer service. example using Yahoo Messenger to listen to customer complaints, or assisting customers who experience confusion about the products they sell.

Right now, I use Tweetdeck. I manage about 5 different accounts. My main attraction to it is that it has an Android app, so I can manage from my desk, or manage while out and about. It's very clean, easy to use, and overall, I've had a better experience with it than CoTweet or Hootsuite.
@bryangarvin I also use both the desktop and android versions of Tweetdeck for the same reasons. It makes it much easier to manage 21 accounts across various platforms.
Hi everybody! I used desktop and iPad version of Tweetdeck, but now i'm using TweetDeck extension for Chrome, it's awesome!!! Less use of memory that Desktop version
I use Orsiso(Desk top App) and threadsy(Web UI) for emails.Threadsy allows twitter and Facebook as well
I also use livego, but not often
@stevennathaniel How about trillian? I don't use it,but would like to know if any body recommends it
I love Trillian. On my mac I used to use Adium, and for a while it was better but now with facebook integration and some other features I much prefer it over any other IM app.

We've developed a product called Hubblr which is currently in private Beta.  It allows you to group your accounts into hubs so that you can monitor/manage a bunch of them at once, rather than checking on each account individually.  It's great for social media professionals who manage accounts for a number of clients or larger organizations with many accounts.  If you'd like an invite to our beta, email me at cameron[at]hubblr.com

Side question: How many people here are using their social media management tool for a group of people? Working for a corporation, I'm always on the lookout for tools that have group abilities (assigning, etc)
I recommend CrowdBooster :)  I've been using to recruit followers on FreezeCrowd's twitter http://twitter.com/freezecrowd
Memolane.com just opened up
Been using social sprout for the past two weeks and love it we are going to sign up for the pro plan.
I'm biased of course, but you should really take a look at www.chumly.com - we offer a lot of the stuff mentioned in this thread, including timed posts to twitter, facebook, wordpress, blogspot...
Tweekdeck is good. I also love NutshellMail for getting updates of all my social media site in one nice email.
